name: Vegan Pumpkin Soup
description: This vegan pumpkin soup with coconut milk is super thick, creamy, and rich. Serve it as a starter for a dinner party or as a comforting main meal on colder days! It's cheap, quick, and very easy to prepare.
recipeIngredient: 25 oz pumpkin ((butternut, sugar pumpkin, or red kuri squash))
1  clove of garlic, finely chopped or minced
1 teaspoon red curry paste ((more if your curry paste is not very spicy))

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the onion and the garlic. Peel and cut the pumpkin, the potatoes, and the carrots into medium cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the onion and the garlic. Peel and cut the pumpkin, the potatoes, and the carrots into medium cubes.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pot and sauté the onion for about 3 minutes or until translucent. Add the the garlic and the ginger and cook for another minute. Then add the pumpkin, the potatoes, and the carrots.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pot and sauté the onion for about 3 minutes or until translucent. Add the the garlic and the ginger and cook for another minute. Then add the pumpkin, the potatoes, and the carrots.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add the vegetable broth and the coconut milk. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes until the vegetables are soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add the vegetable broth and the coconut milk. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes until the vegetables are soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Use an immersion blender to puree the pumpkin soup or transfer it to a blender.
recipeInstructions.name: Use an immersion blender to puree the pumpkin soup or transfer it to a blender.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the red curry paste, the lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the red curry paste, the lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
